definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: The mosquitos are drumming around me.
sentences.chinese: 蚊子正在我周圍嗡嗡亂叫。

sentences.english: Well, get on with your walking! Don't hang about here screaming.
sentences.chinese: 好，你繼續散步吧，但別在這裏亂喊亂叫的。

sentences.english: I spent the next hour chasing, squawking chickens all over the yard.
sentences.chinese: 我趕了一個小時的雞，那些雞滿院子亂飛亂叫。

sentences.english: He stared at me, " what, the others heard thought I want incivility you."
sentences.chinese: 他瞪我，亂叫什麼啊，別人聽到還以爲我要非禮你呢。

sentences.english: The old man was romping in the courtyard with his grandsons.
sentences.chinese: 這位老人在院子裏與他的孫子們亂跑亂叫地耍鬧。

sentences.english: Don't use your dirty duck mouth to shout at us.
sentences.chinese: 別用你的臭鴨嘴對我們亂吼亂叫。

sentences.english: The magpies were chattering in the trees.

sentences.chinese: 他們亂嚷亂叫地唱了一個小時。

sentences.english: The room abounded with screaming children.
sentences.chinese: 房間裏坐滿了哇哇亂叫的孩子。

sentences.english: Why do students met with teachers Luanhan barking?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼學生會見了老師亂喊亂叫？

sentences.english: At this moment, the child was frightened, crying loudly and shouting in confusion.
sentences.chinese: 這時候，小孩害怕了，嚇得“哇哇”地亂哭亂叫。

sentences.english: The ducks squawked and went down the lake.
sentences.chinese: 鴨羣嘎嘎亂叫着衝向湖中。

sentences.english: There's nobody as stupid as a shoemaker, except thaw bay cob.
sentences.chinese: 除了那頭亂叫的矮腳馬，沒人會跟鞋匠一樣蠢。

sentences.english: Because you can't sing without making dogs bark.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你一唱歌連狗都要亂叫。

definition: to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to cry out/to bark out a sound
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
